Knoxville.Gay Street Bridge:
The Gay Street Bridge is a vehicle bridge that crosses the Tennessee River in Knoxville, Tennessee, United States. Completed in 1898, the 1,512-foot (461 m) bridge is the oldest of four vehicle bridges connecting Downtown Knoxville with South Knoxville, the other three being The Henley Bridge(Knox County, Tennessee), the Buck Karnes Bridge (Alcoa Highway), and the James C. Ford Memorial Bridge.


== Design ==
The bridge is a steel spandrel-braced (cantilever) arched design with a concrete deck.
